Expectation1: Repair or replace damaged wooden structures or components
Situation1: A homeowner reports a damaged wooden deck, and the carpenter needs to repair or replace it to restore functionality
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They are expected to attend every service and take part in church community activities consistently
Story:
Sunday morning sunlight streamed through my workshop window as I examined the splintered boards of Mrs. Evans’ deck. She’d called me in a panic last night—her grandson nearly tripped on a loose plank, and she was hosting a family gathering that afternoon. I could see the worry in her eyes when I promised I’d fix it first thing today. My tools were ready, and the wood was stacked by the door.

But as I glanced at the clock, my heart tightened. Church service would start in an hour. Pastor always said our presence mattered, that worship and fellowship were the foundation of our faith. I’d missed last week’s service for a late job, and Sister Ruth had gently reminded me how much the community valued my participation. I knew they expected me to be there, to sing, pray, and help set up for the luncheon afterward.

Standing in my workshop, I felt torn. The deck needed urgent repair—someone could get hurt if I delayed. But my church family counted on me, too. I gripped my hammer, wrestling with the weight of both promises, uncertain which path to take.
